title: Calories in 1 Cup Granulated Sugar
meta_description: Discover calories in 1 cup granulated sugar—about 774 kcal—plus full nutrition breakdown, carbs, sugars, and recipe tweaks for better choices.
assumptions: Standard white granulated sugar; 1 cup ≈ 200 g (unsifted, level measure); pure sucrose, no additives.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, packing density, and measurement; sifted or packed cups differ in weight. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One cup of granulated sugar provides ~774 kcal, all from 200 g of carbs (pure sugars).

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use light brown sugar (packed, similar density)

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 cup granulated sugar?
Is all the calories in sugar from carbs?
faqs.a: Yes, 100% from carbohydrates, specifically 200 g of sugars.

faqs.q: How much sugar is in 1 cup granulated sugar?
faqs.a: About 200 g, all simple sugars with no fiber or protein.

faqs.q: Does the type of sugar affect calories per cup?
faqs.a: Yes—powdered is lighter (≈464 kcal/cup), brown slightly higher due to molasses.

faqs.q: Why measure sugar by weight instead of cups?
faqs.a: Cups vary by packing; 1 cup can be 180–220 g, affecting calorie accuracy.
